content: a break in the fog is a soft triangle shawl with gentle crescent shaping along the top edge to help it drape across the shoulders without sliding off the shawl is worked in 4ply fingering weight yarn and two versions are given version 1 uses a colour changing gradient yarn and version 2 is worked in two contrasting colours in the second version 2 skeins of the main colour and 1 skein of the contrast are needed approximately 900-1100m of yarn is required the shawl is worked with a 3 5mm us4 hook gauge isn t vital for this project though if your gauge is tighter or looser than mine you may find you use less or more yarn in my version 10cm = 20 treble stitches and 6 of the 2 row pattern repeats for the main body of the shawl finished size is 140cm wide and 60cm deep this shawl is available in both uk and us terms **note members of the nsw knitters guild can get the pattern for free until the 2025 fibrefest guild members can find the pattern on the guild website in the member s area **
